text: typhoon augury is a real monster these
shots taken from the International Space
Station showed just how big it is in the
last few hours it's been downgraded from
a super typhoon but it's still 400
kilometers wide and packing winds of 240
km/h this morning the center of the
storm swept ashore on the southern
Japanese island of Okinawa this wooden
building was torn from its foundations
and dumped into the middle of the road
but so far the damage has been limited
and most people appear to have heeded
government warnings not to go outside
that includes 30 thousand US troops who
are based in up you know on the
Okinawans and Japanese no typhoons like
nobody else
what lockdown means is everybody has to
go to their home of residence and
they're not supposed to leave their
house under any situation any
circumstance the good news is that there
have been only a handful of injuries
reported we have not received any
information concerning great damage or
injury the Prime Minister has ordered
the government to provide information to
our citizens and to prepare thoroughly
for any disaster and to respond quickly
if anything should happen the typhoon is
now heading north towards the Japanese
mainland it is weakening but it's still
carrying a huge amount of moisture when
it reaches the mainland all of that
moisture will turn to rain
Rupert Linfield Hayes BBC News in Tokyo
